<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.Ex5.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="fib(G\to G/H)\to G\to BGL_{1}({\mathbb{S}})\to{\mathcal{S}}." display="block"><mrow><mi>f</mi><mi>i</mi><mi>b</mi><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>G</mi><mo>→</mo><mi>G</mi><mo>/</mo><mi>H</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>→</mo><mi>G</mi><mo>→</mo><mi>B</mi><mi>G</mi><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>𝕊</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>→</mo><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic">𝒮</mi><mo>.</mo></mrow></math>

nexttext: In other words, there is a family of $\infty$-operads indexed by $\Delta^1$ which looks like $G^\otimes$ (the $\infty$-operad associated to $G$ as an ${\mathbb{E}}_n$-monoidal Kan complex) at one end and $G/H^\otimes$ at the other end.  Formula $(\ast)$ of Definition 3.1.2.2 of \cite{ha} states that the value of the desired Kan extension at a 0-simplex $\sigma\in G/H$ is given by the colimit diagram:
mathml:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.Ex6.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\mathcal{M}^{\otimes}\simeq(G^{\otimes}\times\Delta^{1})\coprod_{G^{\otimes}%
\times\{1\}}G/H^{\otimes}\to{\mathcal{F}in_{\ast}}\times\Delta^{1}." display="block"><mrow><mrow><msup><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic">ℳ</mi><mo>⊗</mo></msup><mo>≃</mo><mrow><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><msup><mi>G</mi><mo>⊗</mo></msup><mo>×</mo><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mn>1</mn></msup></mrow><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><munder><mo largeop="true" movablelimits="false" symmetric="true">∐</mo><mrow><msup><mi>G</mi><mo>⊗</mo></msup><mo>×</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">{</mo><mn>1</mn><mo stretchy="false">}</mo></mrow></mrow></munder><mrow><mi>G</mi><mo>/</mo><msup><mi>H</mi><mo>⊗</mo></msup></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>→</mo><mrow><mrow><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic">ℱ</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>i</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>n</mi><mo>∗</mo></msub></mrow><mo>×</mo><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mn>1</mn></msup></mrow></mrow><mo>.</mo></mrow></math>

prevtext: In other words, there is a family of $\infty$-operads indexed by $\Delta^1$ which looks like $G^\otimes$ (the $\infty$-operad associated to $G$ as an ${\mathbb{E}}_n$-monoidal Kan complex) at one end and $G/H^\otimes$ at the other end.  Formula $(\ast)$ of Definition 3.1.2.2 of \cite{ha} states that the value of the desired Kan extension at a 0-simplex $\sigma\in G/H$ is given by the colimit diagram:

nexttext: where the right adjoint $\Theta$ is given by composition with the quotient map $q:G\to G/H$ and the left adjoint $Lan_q$ is given by taking the left operadic Kan extension along $q$ (here the operad in question is ${\mathbb{E}}_{n-1}^\otimes$, but for simplicity we leave it out of the notation). Hence we have an equivalence of mapping spaces:
mathml: <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.Ex10.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="Lan_{q}:Alg_{G}({\mathcal{S}})\leftrightarrows Alg_{G/H}({\mathcal{S}}):\Theta" display="block"><mrow><mrow><mi>L</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>a</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>n</mi><mi>q</mi></msub></mrow><mo>:</mo><mrow><mrow><mi>A</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>l</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>g</mi><mi>G</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic">𝒮</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>⇆</mo><mrow><mi>A</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>l</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>g</mi><mrow><mi>G</mi><mo>/</mo><mi>H</mi></mrow></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic">𝒮</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>:</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Θ</mi></mrow></math>

nexttext: where $c:BGL_1({\mathbb{S}})\hookrightarrow{\mathcal{S}}\simeq LMod_{\mathbb{S}}$ is the canonical inclusion (note that on the left hand side we are implicitly using the fact that $\psi\circ q\simeq c\circ f$ by the definition of a Kan extension). By the natural equivalence of  Lemma \ref{univquot}, we obtain an equivalence of mapping spaces
prevtext: where the right adjoint $\Theta$ is given by composition with the quotient map $q:G\to G/H$ and the left adjoint $Lan_q$ is given by taking the left operadic Kan extension along $q$ (here the operad in question is ${\mathbb{E}}_{n-1}^\otimes$, but for simplicity we leave it out of the notation). Hence we have an equivalence of mapping spaces:

<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.Ex11.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="Alg_{G}({\mathcal{S}})(c\circ f,\phi\circ q)\simeq Alg_{G/H}({\mathcal{S}})(%

prevtext: where $u\circ c'\circ t$ is the composition
